Takeaways

• Segmented buttons were previously known as toggle buttons
  • Single-select segmented buttons are used to select a single option, switch between views or sort elements
  • Multi-select segmented buttons are used to select multiple options from a group of options or filter elements
What's new

• Color: New color mappings and compatibility with dynamic color
  • Icons: Optional check icon to indicate selected state
  • Layout: Taller container height of 40dp
  • Name and types: Segmented buttons were previously known as toggle buttons. They now have two official types: single-select and multi-select.
  • Shape: Fully rounded corners
  • Typography: Labels use sentence case instead of all caps

contentChunks.htmlValue: Usage
Segmented buttons help people select options, switch views, or sort elements.

contentChunks.footer: A segmented button can help switch between viewing restaurant and bar options.
contentChunks.altText: Desktop UI of map location results with segmented button

contentChunks.htmlValue:
There are 2 types of segmented buttons:

  1. Single-select
  2. Multi-select

contentChunks.footer:
1. Single-select segmented button can only have 1 segment selected
2. Mult-select segmenteed button can have multiple segments selected.

contentChunks.htmlValue:
Segments

Segmented buttons can have 2-5 segments. Each segment is clearly divided and contains label text, an icon, or both.

contentChunks.footer: There can be anywhere from 2 to 5 segments in single-select and multi-select segmented buttons.
contentChunks.altText: Side by side view of segmented buttons each with additional segment starting from 2 to 5

contentChunks.footer: Segmented buttons are best used for selecting between 2 and 5 choices.
contentChunks.altText: Mobile UI of data usage screen with segmented button

contentChunks.footer: Don’t use more than five segments in a single segmented button. Choices should be scoped. If you have more than five choices, consider using another component, such as chips.
contentChunks.altText: Incorrect use of segmented button with 6 segments

contentChunks.htmlValue:
Container

Like common buttons, segmented buttons have fully rounded corners by default.

contentChunks.footer: Segmented buttons have fully rounded corners.
contentChunks.altText: Close up detail of segmented button with fully rounded corners

contentChunks.htmlValue:
Icons

Icons may be used as labels by themselves or alongside text. 

If an icon is used without label text, it must clearly communicate the option it represents.

contentChunks.footer: Segmented buttons can include icons.
contentChunks.altText: Side by side view of segmented buttons with different configurations of icons and label text

contentChunks.htmlValue:
Label text

Labels should be short and succinct. If a label is too long to fit within its segment, consider using an icon alone.

contentChunks.footer: Use labels that are as clear and short as possible.
contentChunks.altText: Mobile UI of music app showing a segmented button with options for music, albums, podcasts

contentChunks.footer: Keep labels short and consistent in length.
contentChunks.altText: Segmented button with options for day, week, month

contentChunks.footer: Don’t allow segments to wrap onto a new line.
contentChunks.altText: Segmented button with 3 segments and 4th segment wrapped onto new line sits above filled button with label reading find options

contentChunks.footer: Use consistent label types.
contentChunks.altText: Segmented button with text labels reading day, week, month

contentChunks.footer: Icons can be used in place of labels, but they must clearly communicate their meaning.
contentChunks.altText: Segmented button with icons only labels for walking, transit, driving

contentChunks.footer: Avoid mixing icon-only labels with text labels. Choose one label type and use that type for all segments.
contentChunks.altText: Segmented button with 2 icon only options indicating favorite and bookmark and 3rd option with text label reading recent

contentChunks.footer: Use icons instead of long labels that exceed the space of the button. On hover, a tooltip should describe the button’s action.
Avoid truncating long labels. Instead, use icons (with tooltips).

contentChunks.htmlValue: Single-select

Use a single-select segmented button to select one option from a set, switch between views, or sort elements from up to five options. 

For example, use a single-select segmented button to choose one of a set of sizes, such as this beverage size selector.

contentChunks.footer: A single select segmented button for choosing beverage size.
contentChunks.altText: Mobile UI for ecommerce app with segmented button with 3 beverage size options

contentChunks.htmlValue: Multi-select

Use a multi-select segmented button to select or sort from two to five options. Unlike single-select, selection is not required and a user may concurrently select anywhere from all to none of the options. 

For example, multi-select segmented buttons can be used to filter by price range when searching for a restaurant.

contentChunks.footer: A multi-select segmented button for filtering restaurant search options.
contentChunks.altText: Mobile UI for ecommerce app with multi-select segmented button with 4 price range options

contentChunks.htmlValue: Placement
Segmented buttons should have adequate margins from the edge of the viewport or frame.

contentChunks.footer: Allow adequate space for margins. The button container shouldn’t reach the edge of the viewport.
contentChunks.altText: Mobile UI with 2-segment segmented button and 4-segment segmented button each with same padding between button containers and viewport edge

contentChunks.htmlValue: Segmented buttons can be placed on other components, such as bottom sheets, floating sheets, or full-screen dialogs.

contentChunks.footer: A segmented button can be placed on a bottom sheet.
contentChunks.altText: Mobile UI with segmented button in bottom sheet

contentChunks.htmlValue: Behavior
When using both icons and label text in segmented buttons, the icon label is replaced by the checkmark icon when the segment is selected.

contentChunks.footer: Icons become checkmarks when selected in buttons that also use label text.
contentChunks.altText: Segmented button with icon and text labels with checkmark icon in selected segment
